q: wake of the Tucson tragedy, politicians from both sides of the aisle have called for a more civil discourse in our political debate. On CBS's Face the Nation this morning, John McCain ( R-AZ) said, There is a lack of respect in our dialogue.... We shouldn't mistake passion for advocacy. In other words, passion is necessary in this debate that we're having, but we've got to make sure it doesn't spill over into personal attacks and impugning people's character or patriotism. Mr David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today programme: He is, as anyone would be, extremely embarrassed about what happened. "He's effectively been punished twice for the same offence. I gave him a second chance. Sometimes I think it's right to do that. "Working for the Government, I think he's done a good job. last season on At the Idol finale on May 26, 2010, a wistful Simon Cowell looked out over the crowd one last time. "It felt very weird," he says, remembering the moment. When you're standing there in front of 5,000, 6,000 people and you feel this warmth and emotion; that's when I felt more emotional than I ever thought I would feel. We've had this amazing run.
